subject: Re: [junit] Re: Reply required urgently in creating HTML reports
msgSnippet: ... You re asking an ANT-specific question to the JUnit group, rather than the ant-user group where you might have better success. Nevertheless, have you tried
messageBody:
On 01/09/05, poojar2710 <poojar2710@...> wrote:
>
> yes simple.java define a test suite. My only problem is that "TESTS-
> TestSuites.xml" is not showing anything. So please let me know what
> are the possible causes for this.
> Thanks
> Pooja
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Bradley, Todd" <todd.bradley@p...>
> wrote:
> > You refer to "individual tests" as if you're running
> > more than one test. But your build file is set up to
> > only run a single test, called Simple.class. Does
> > Simple.java define a test suite?
> >
> >
> > Todd.
> >
> >
> > > -----Original Message-----
> > > From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> > > Behalf Of poojar2710
> > > Sent: Tuesday, August 30, 2005 9:37 PM
> > > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > > Subject: [junit] Re: Reply required urgently in creating HTML
> reports
> > >
> > > My class file is at C:/ISMC and the tests are running also as
> > > the XML file "TEST-Simple.xml" is generated properly with the
> > > required output but "TESTS-TestSuites.xml" is not having any
> > > details of the test run. It has just two lines:
> > > <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
> > > <testsuites></testsuites>
> > >
> > > This shows that the above XML file(TESTS-TestSuites.xml) is
> > > not able to collect data from individual tests' XML file. And
> > > I'm not able to figure out the possible reason for this.
> > > Could you help me in this.
> > >
> > > Thanks & Regards,
> > > Pooja
> > >
> > > --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Bradley, Todd" <todd.bradley@p...>
> > > wrote:
> > > > I think your tests aren't running at all, which explains
> > > why your XML
> > > > files are empty. Is your class file really in C:/ISMC and not
> > > > something like C:/ISMC/build/tests?
> > > >
> > > > You might need to change
> > > > <include name="Simple.class" />
> > > >
> > > > to
> > > > <include name="**/*Simple.class" />
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > Todd.
> > > >
> > > > > -----Original Message-----
> > > > > From: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > > [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf
> > > > > Of poojar2710
> > > > > Sent: Tuesday, August 30, 2005 12:57 AM
> > > > > To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> > > > > Subject: [junit] Reply required urgently in creating HTML
> reports
> > > > >
> > > > > Hello,
> > > > > Could anyone please help me in creating HTML reports
> > > using ANT task
> > > > > with JUNIT.
> > > > >
> > > > > I ran the below xml file using ANT but the HTML reports
> generated
> > > > > doesn't show any details of the test run though the XML
> > > file "Test-
> > > > > Classname.xml" shows complete details.
> > > > >
> > > > > <project basedir="C:/ISMC" default="Simple-html" > <property
> > > > > name="test.reports" value="C:/ISMC/Reports" /> <property
> > > > > name="test.class.name <http://test.class.name>" value="Simple" />
> > > > >
> > > > > <path id="test.classpath">
> > > > > <pathelement location="C:/ISMC" />
> > > > > <pathelement location="C:/ISMC/junit3" />
> > > > > <pathelement location="C:/jdk1.4/bin" />
> > > > > <pathelement location="C:/jdk1.4/lib" /> </path>
> > > > >
> > > > > <target name="Simple-html">
> > > > > <junit fork="yes" printsummary="no" haltonfailure="no">
> > > > > <batchtest fork="yes" todir="${test.reports}" >
> > > > > <fileset dir="C:/ISMC">
> > > > > <include name="Simple.class" />
> > > > > </fileset>
> > > > > </batchtest>
> > > > > <formatter type="xml" />
> > > > > <classpath refid="test.classpath"/>
> > > > > </junit>
> > > > >
> > > > > <junitreport todir="${test.reports}">
> > > > > <fileset dir="${test.reports}">
> > > > > <include name="Test-*.xml" />
> > > > > </fileset>
> > > > > <report todir="${test.reports}" />
> > > > > </junitreport>
> > > > > </target>
> > > > > </project>
> > > > >
> > > > > Also the TESTS-TestSuites.xml file just shows the below two
> > > lines :
> > > > > <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
> <testsuites></testsuites>
> > > > >
> > > > > Regards,
> > > > > Pooja
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > > >

> programming language<http://groups.yahoo.com/gads?t=ms&k=C+++programming+language&w1=Basic+programming+language&w2=C+programming+language&w3=Computer+programming+languages&w4=The+c+programming+language&w5=C+++programming+language&w6=List+of+programming+languages&c=6&s=193&.sig=dtKotXT1Ne2N9AO_aEbPFQ> List
> of programming languages<http://groups.yahoo.com/gads?t=ms&k=List+of+programming+languages&w1=Basic+programming+language&w2=C+programming+language&w3=Computer+programming+languages&w4=The+c+programming+language&w5=C+++programming+language&w6=List+of+programming+languages&c=6&s=193&.sig=0shmxLBHwrZWcSjC3QvZAA>

You're asking an ANT-specific question to the JUnit group, rather than the
ant-user group where you might have better success. Nevertheless, have you
tried running ANT with the verbose switch or higher to see what is contained
in the filterset used by batchtest? It looks like it's looking for
Simple.class in C:/ISMC - is this where the test class is?

James


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
